schemeContent.detailedDescription_md: The Educational Assistance to the 10th to 12th Students scheme was launched by the Maharashtra Building And Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (MBOCWW), Labour Department Maharashtra. Under this scheme, educational assistance of ₹10,000/- to the children of the registered worker scoring 50% or more marks in the 10th and 12th standard examinations.

eligibilityCriteria.eligibilityDescription_md:
1. The children's parents or guardians should be registered under the Maharashtra Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
1. The child must have passed the 10th or 12th standard with at least 50% marks.
1. Only children and spouse of registered construction workers are eligible to get educational assistance.

children.text: The children's parents or guardians should be registered under the Maharashtra Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The child must have passed the 10th or 12th standard with at least 50% marks.
Only children and spouse of registered construction workers are eligible to get educational assistance.

faqs.question: What is the amount of educational assistance under this scheme?
faqs.answer: ₹10,000 for children scoring 50% or more in 10th or 12th standard exams.

faqs.question: How many children can benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme extends benefits to a maximum of two children per registered worker.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Registered workers of the Maharashtra Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, and their children or spouse, are eligible.

faqs.question: Is there any minimum percentage required to avail of the assistance?
faqs.answer: Yes, the child must score 50% or more in their 10th or 12th standard exams.

faqs.question: Is this scheme available for students outside Maharashtra?
faqs.answer: No, the child must reside in Maharashtra and be enrolled in a recognized institution.

faqs.question: Can the wife of a registered worker apply for this assistance?
faqs.answer: Yes, the wife of a registered male worker can apply.

faqs.question: What documents are required to apply?
faqs.answer: Aadhaar card, school mark sheet, ID card from MBOCWW, and a bank passbook.

faqs.question: Where can I submit the application form?
faqs.answer: The form can be submitted to the nearest Labour Commissioner’s office or Government Labour Officer.

faqs.question: Is the scheme available for children who have scored less than 50%?
faqs.answer: No, only students who score 50% or more in their exams are eligible.

faqs.question: Is this benefit available for higher studies as well?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is only for 10th and 12th standard students.

faqs.question: What if I face issues while applying for the scheme?
faqs.answer: You can contact the Maharashtra Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board for assistance.
